brief_description: Delineate the effect of aging from that of cytomegalovirus (CMV) infection upon relative and absolute changes in blood T cell subsets.
condition_studied: Aging and cytomegalovirus infection differentially and jointly affect distinct circulating T cell subsets in humans
description: Delineate the effect of aging from that of cytomegalovirus (CMV) infection upon relative and absolute changes in blood T cell subsets using a cohort of 391 individuals ranging in age from 21-101yrs, seperated into two subgroups based on serological CMV status.
endpoints: Flow cytometry for Tcell phenotype, ELISA for CMV serology
hypothesis: Aging and CMV infeciton affect absolute numbers of T cell subsets.
objectives: Determine the distinct roles of chronological aging as well as prior CMV infection on the absolute changes in blood T cell subsets.
official_title: Aging and cytomegalovirus infection differentially and jointly affect distinct circulating T cell subsets in humans
